definition: To learn without thinking is confusing, to think without learning is dangerous (Confucius)

traditional: 學而不思則罔，思而不學則殆
word: 学而不思则罔，思而不学则殆

definition: study tirelessly (idiom, from Analects)
those who understand others are clever, but those who know themselves are truly wise (idiom, from Laozi's 道德經|道德经[Dao4 de2 jing1]
pinyin: zhi1 ren2 zhe3 zhi4 , zi4 zhi1 zhe3 ming2

definition: Knowledge is not innate to man, how can we overcome doubt?/We are not born with knowledge, how does one achieve maturity? (i.e. without guidance from a teacher - Tang dynasty essayist Han Yu 韓愈|韩愈)
pinyin: ren2 fei1 sheng1 er2 zhi1 zhi1 zhe3 , shu2 neng2 wu2 huo4
related.word: 人非生而知之者，孰能无惑

definition: sincere belief and diligent study
(idiom) complacency leads to loss, modesty brings profit/pride comes before a fall
pinyin: man3 zhao1 sun3 , qian1 shou4 yi4

definition: to study the underlying principle to acquire knowledge (idiom); pursuing knowledge to the end
Mencius (c. 372-c. 289 BC), Confucian philosopher second only to Confucius/book of the same name, one of the classics of Confucianism
Xun Zi or Hsun Tzu (c. 310-237 BC), Confucian philosopher and author of On learning 勸學|劝学
so dedicated as to forget one's meals (idiom)
if you are lazy in your prime, you'll be sorry in your old age
pinyin: shao4 zhuang4 bu4 nu3 li4 , lao3 da4 tu2 shang1 bei1
related.word: 少壮不努力，老大徒伤悲
